comments:
1)Craete a new WSDL.
2)Add an import (Right-click in the Imports group and select Add Import from 
the context menu).  Don't specify the location of the import.
3)An Error Dialog will appear:
An internal error has occurred during: "Processing Dirty Regions".

*****
This is the stackoverflow.  Alternatively, the stackoverflow can be caused by 
right-clicking on a WSDL file with an import (no location or namespace 
specified), and select validate.

Look at the method:
org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.validation ----> WSDLDocument.parseMessage(Element, 
Definition)
On line 907:
msg = def.getMessage(messageName)
starts the infinite loop.

Here's the stack:
java.lang.StackOverflowError
	at java.lang.String.hashCode(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.HashMap.hash(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.HashMap.get(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getImports(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getFromImports(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getMessage(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getFromImports(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getMessage(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getFromImports(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getMessage(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getFromImports(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getMessage(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getFromImports(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getMessage(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getFromImports(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getMessage(Unknown Source)
	at com.ibm.wsdl.DefinitionImpl.getFromImports(Unknown Source)
........
........
*** Bug 91762 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

WSDL imports with the location attribute specified with no location as in
<wsdl:import namespace="http://somenamespace" location=""/>
are no longer added to the WSDL model used for validation. An error is now 
produced for this situation and the stack overflow no longer occurs.

This fix will be in the 20050418 6pm EDT I-Build.

Verified as fixed in the 20050419 Integration build.
Thanks Lawrence.
